tagline: Student-built. Free to join. Beginner friendly.

faqs.a: Australian uni and TAFE students, recent grads, and early-career participants. International students studying in Australia are also welcome!
No experience required! We have a beginner route with guided challenges and mentors available throughout the event.
Teams can have up to 4 players. You can register solo and find a team later, or register with your existing team.
Just a laptop, internet connection, and a modern browser. No special software required!
Yes, completely free! No hidden costs or premium tiers.
Read our beginner guide, try the teaser challenge, and join our Discord for tips and community support.
Yes! We have prizes for top teams and individuals, plus recognition for all participants. Details announced closer to the event.
The event runs in Australian Eastern Daylight Time (AEDT). We provide time zone converters and schedule information for all participants.
The event is designed for Australian students, but international participants are welcome if they meet the eligibility criteria.
Our mentor team is available throughout the event via Discord. We also provide hints and beginner-friendly resources.

teaserChallenge.question: What's the most common password in the world? (Hint: it's not 'password')

quotes.text: The best CTF I've participated in. Great community and challenging problems!
quotes.author: Sarah Chen

quotes.text: Perfect for beginners like me. The mentors were incredibly helpful.
quotes.author: Alex Thompson

meta.description: Free 24 hour student-built cybersecurity competition for Australian uni students. Beginner friendly. Join solo or as a team.
meta.keywords: CTF, cybersecurity, competition, students, Australia, capture the flag, hacking, security
meta.author: ACUCyS
